facts.title: Your brain has 86 billion neurons
facts.description: Neurons are specialized cells that form the basic building blocks of the brain. Each of the 86 billion neurons in the human brain can connect with thousands of others, creating a vast network that enables everything from basic bodily functions to complex thoughts and emotions.

facts.title: Water expands when it freezes
facts.description: Unlike most substances, water expands by about 9% when it freezes. This unique property is why ice floats in water and is crucial for life on Earth, as it allows aquatic life to survive under frozen water bodies.
